Cough.report: Frequent linkage observed due to viral infections causing both fever and cough.

Headache.report: Fever often triggers vascular headaches due to dehydration and heat exposure.

Shortness of Breath.report: Prolonged fever from respiratory infections can induce breathlessness.

Body Ache.report: Fever commonly accompanies body aches in flu or viral syndromes.

Fever.report: Coughing often accompanies fever in common cold and influenza.

Chest Pain.report: Chronic cough may cause intercostal strain leading to mild chest discomfort.

Body Ache.report: Viral syndromes with cough commonly include diffuse myalgia and malaise.

Chest Pain.report: Strong correlation; both are symptoms of cardiac or pulmonary conditions.

Fever.report: Less common link, typically observed in pneumonia or COVID-like infections.

Cold.report: Upper respiratory infections commonly present with headache due to sinus inflammation.

Cough.report: Persistent cough can trigger tension-type headaches via muscle strain and poor sleep.

Fever.report: Fever frequently coexists with headache from cytokine response and dehydration.

Shortness of Breath.report: Cardiopulmonary conditions often produce concurrent chest pain and breathlessness.

Fatigue.report: Reduced cardiac or pulmonary reserve can manifest as chest discomfort with fatigue.
